headline: 'That's A Dumb Thing To Think,' Dave Ramsey Snaps As 29-Year-Old Making $50K Explains Why She Took On A $14K Car Loan With $77K In Debt
summary: A 29-year-old earning $50,000 a year took on a $14,000 car loan while carrying $77,000 in debt. Megan from Indianapolis called "The Ramsey Show," saying she felt "scared and stressed" after laying out a debt load totaling about $77,000 on a $50,000 income. She said she owes about $15,000 in credit cards, $32,000 in student loans, nearly $9,000 in personal debt, roughly $6,000 in back taxes, a medical bill of about $1,000, and $14,000 on a vehicle. headline: Amazon Stock And Meta Lagged In 2025. Here's Why They Are This Analyst's Top 2026 Picks.
summary: Amazon and Meta Platforms both underperformed the S&P 500 last year but the stocks could rally in 2026, Bernstein analysts said Monday.  Amazon and Meta are the firm's top large capitalization technology stock picks.  Bernstein analysts led by Mark Shmulik reiterated an outperform call for shares of both Meta and Amazon in the client note Monday previewing 2026.

content.title: Amazon Stock And Meta Lagged In 2025. Here's Why They Are This Analyst's Top 2026 Picks.

headline: Can We Retire at 62 With $690K In A Roth IRA, $1,800 In Social Security, And No Mortgage — But $500 A Month In Out-of-Pocket Medical Costs?
summary: Retiring at 62 sounds doable when the house is paid off and there's a solid nest egg waiting. But for one Florida couple, even a well-prepped plan feels like it's riding a tightrope. Together, they've saved $690,000 in a Roth IRA and expect $1,800 a month in combined Social Security benefits. Their mortgage is gone, which lifts a major weight. But their biggest concern heading into retirement isn't housing — it's healthcare. They're budgeting $500 a month out-of-pocket for Medicare premiums, pre
